text.p: Here are highlights from Polish newspapers this morning.
RZECZPOSPOLITA
- Monthly net salary growth in real terms in Polish firms declined in January and February though it was higher than at the start of 1996, the Central Statistical Office (GUS) said.
Average monthly pay in the mining sector was 1,609 zlotys , which was almost 300 percent higher than in light industry.

- Polish computer crime is not limited to illegal software duplication and increasingly includes criminal acts committed through the Internet or companies' internal networks, police computer crime head Andrzej Karp said.
- The Polska Zegluga Baltycka (PZB) shipping firm will introduce an Australian constructed catamaran ferry vessel to cruise on the Swinoujscie-Malmo line in June's second half.
The vessel can hold up to 700 passengers, 175 cars, 10 buses and 70 trucks at a maximum speed of 75 km per hour.
- Seven housing cooperatives in Olsztyn, northeastern Poland, have declined to accept the second energy price rise in the last four months by the local MPEC heating and hot water monopolist supplier.
The cooperatives formed an antimonopoly unit to represent their members in dealing with MPEC.
- Warsaw-based Kredyt Bank (KB) has acquired a 35.15 percent stake in the Agropolis agricultural sector insurance firm worth 1.5 million zlotys, the bank said.
- The Warta SA major insurance firm's supervisory board has decided to acquire a 10-15 percent stake in Powszechny Bank Kredytowy (PBK), undergoing privatisation this year.
NOWA EUROPA
- Austria' Creditanstalt bank has offered 422 million zlotys for Polski Bank Inwestycyjny (PBI) and Prosper Bank, both soon to be privatised, Austrian daily Die Presse said.
- Bank Handlowy Capital Operations Centre (BH COK) analysts recommend buying stock of the listed KPBP Bick construction firm in a report dated 28 February.
GAZETA WYBORCZA
- The Atlantis construction material maker will issue five million shares to obtain development funds reaching 35 million zlotys, company president Pawel Obrebski said.
ZYCIE
- The Mielec motor vehicle maker will produce 35 handmade Cobra cars by the end of the year.
The cars have been ordered by U.S.-based contractors.
